column4: What do you folks backup for a disaster recovery? Currently I backup /home, /etc, /usr, and /var. I'm I missing anything?
if you backup /usr, then you might as well just backup the entire filesystem i guess...
so I'm seeing, I'm taring it now and it has been cooking for an hour, and is no where near done.
how do you view private messages ,and don't tell Ubotu to send me one. :)
where you following the thread, he is trying to crack his "uncles" network.
no i didn't follow from the start, i just noticed messages i shouldn't be seeing and backscrolled a little.
roger that, he wanted help setting up port forwarding, and it turns out he didn't have access to the router, and then it got weird.
I trying to figure out how to change my name as it appears here?
/nick newnickname
if you're on moderated channels (or you're muted somewhere), you won't be able to change your nickname
are we moderated here? I want to figure this out, so when I'm working on my friends computer, I'll show up as n2diy, and not neil.
no, we're not. type /mode #channelname, if +m shows up it means it's moderated. but we're not.
roger that.
channel topic
type /topic, it mentions the libc6 problems
ah, ok.
seems the directory doesn't have the right permissions, to me
it's probably a file that's only created while kppp is running, and then deleted (like a lock file). but if it can't write to the directory, it can't create the file.
roger, that would explain why it doesn't exsist on the other box.
do it for that directory that kppp.pid is supposed to reside in (if that's what you were talking about), and compare it with your other box
if the permissions are different, well...
